head.title: Extract Barcodes from Excel, Word, PDF & Other Document via {{ProductName}} API
head.description: {{ProductFullName}} enables software developers to extract Barcodes from PDF, MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint,  Outlook, OneNote & more docs inside {{ProductName}} Apps.

header.title: How to Extract Barcodes from PDF, DOCX, PPTX, EML, MSG,  XLSX & EPUB via {ProductName}} API
header.description: {{ProductFullName}} API enables software developers to extract Barcodes from PDF, Word (DOC, DOCX), Excel (XLS, XLSX), PowerPoint( PPT, PPTX), Outlook ( EML, MSG)  & many other documents Page Area.

about.title: How to Extract Barcodes from {{EXT}} files {{ProductName}} API?
about.h1: Barcodes image consists of a series of parallel black lines and white spaces of varying widths which can be used to encode information into a visual pattern. It was introduced in the 1970s and is now a universal part of commercial businesses. {{ProductFullName}} is a powerful API that allows software programmers to build applications for parsing different types of documents and extract text, images and barcodes from it. It has included support for some of the most common documents types such as PDF, Emails, Ebooks, Microsoft Office formats: Word (DOC, DOCX), PowerPoint (PPT, PPTX), Excel (XLS, XLSX), Emails (EML, MSG) formats and many more.  The {{ProductName}} API has included support for several important features related to documents parsing and data extraction such as plain text extraction, structured text extraction, extract markdown formatted text,  extracting text from a specific page or page area,  extract barcode from document, extract metadata or images and many more.

content_left.description: [{{ProductFullName}}]({{slash_lang}}/parser/{{ProductCode}}/) makes it easy for {{ProgLang}} developers to extract barcodes from a {{EXT}} file by implementing a few easy steps.
content_left.step_1: Instantiate [Parser](https://reference.groupdocs.com/net/parser/groupdocs.parser/parser) object for the initial document;
content_left.step_2: Check if the file supports barcode extracting;
content_left.step_3: Call [getBarcodes](https://reference.groupdocs.com/parser/java/com.groupdocs.parser/parser/#getBarcodes--) method and obtain collection of [PageBarcodeArea](https://reference.groupdocs.com/parser/java/com.groupdocs.parser.data/pagebarcodearea/) objects;
content_left.step_4: Iterate through the collection and get a barcode value.

content_right.step_3: How to extract barcodes from document page area

content_left.description: {{ProductFullName}} APIs are supported on all major platforms and operating systems. Before executing the code below, please make sure that you have the following prerequisites installed on your system.
content_left.step_1: Operating Systems: Microsoft Windows, Linux, MacOS
content_left.step_4: Download the latest version of {{ProductFullName}} from [{{RepoName}}]({{RepoUrl}})

content_right.p1: Plain text extraction support from any supported documents
content_right.p4: Text searching via keyword as well as regular expression
content_right.p5: Extract formatted text, metadata, images, containers, and attachments
content_right.p6: Extract table of contents for some supported document formats
content_right.p7: Parse form data from PDF documents
